page.title: 02RELIGION
page.content: There has probably been a church at Patrington since Anglo-Saxon times.It is one of the finest parish churches in the country with the beauty of a small cathedral.The building is built in the shape of a cross,141 feet in length and 86 feet across the arms.The central tower has a spire climbing to a weathercock 189 feet above the churchyard.Except for fragments of an earlier building,it is almost entirely 14th century,built during the 40 years before the Black Death halved the population of England so that the work was not finished until 1410.An appeal has been launched this year to raise Â£250,000 for urgent repairs to the spire and roof.
